description: System-generated unique identifier for the asset record.
Organization’s unit/asset number used to identify the equipment in operations and maintenance.
Owning or managing organization for the asset.
Reference to a finance record (e.g., GL account, project, or purchase document) linked to the asset; confirm with SME.
Current lifecycle status of the asset (e.g., active, out of service, disposed).
Model year of the asset per manufacturer.
Manufacturer or brand of the asset.
Manufacturer model designation or type.
Code representing the fleet class or category of the asset.
Vehicle registration plate assigned by the registering authority.
Jurisdiction or state where the asset is registered or operated.
Manufacturer-assigned Vehicle Identification Number or serial number uniquely identifying the asset.
Code for the department to which the asset is assigned.
Description of the assigned department.
Maintenance shop code responsible for the asset.
Name or description of the maintenance shop or facility.
Scheduled availability of the asset, likely hours per day; confirm with SME.
Primary exterior color of the asset.
Gross vehicle weight or rating for the asset; confirm units and whether GVW or GVWR.
Code describing drivetrain configuration (e.g., 4x2, AWD); confirm code set with SME.
Text description of the drivetrain configuration.
Serial number of the body or mounted equipment, if applicable.
Serial number identifying the chassis or frame component.
Site or campus where the asset is based or assigned; confirm definition.
Specific location, bay, or area where the asset is stored or assigned.
Postal code for the asset’s assigned site or location.
Free-text operational notes, history, or disposition comments about the asset.
Identifier the supplier or vendor uses for this asset (vendor unit or asset number).
Fuel card identifier assigned to the asset for fueling transactions.
Operational priority used to rank the asset for service or response.
Code for an asset monitoring or telematics/PM grouping; confirm with SME.
Name or description of the monitoring group the asset belongs to.
Code indicating the asset’s usage category or business unit.
Text description of the asset’s usage category.
Date the asset was placed into active service.
Date the asset was acquired or received.
Total acquisition cost recorded for the asset, in currency.
Vehicle or equipment title document identifier or ownership designation; confirm use.
Method of acquisition (e.g., owned, leased, donated).
Identifier of the asset that this unit replaced, if any.
Planned useful life of the asset in months for lifecycle or depreciation.
Primary fuel type used by the asset.
Capacity of the primary fuel tank.
Unit of measure for the primary fuel capacity.
Secondary fuel or fluid type (e.g., alternate fuel, DEF).
Capacity of the secondary fuel or fluid tank.
Unit of measure for the secondary fuel or fluid capacity.
Engine size (displacement or power rating); units and basis may vary—confirm with SME.
Manufacturer serial number for the engine.
Engine oil capacity used for servicing; confirm unit.
Type of the primary usage meter (e.g., miles or hours).
Most recent reading of the primary meter.
Target service life threshold tied to meter 1 for replacement or overhaul planning.
Meter 1 reading recorded at acquisition or baseline.
Date the baseline reading for meter 1 was recorded.
Life-to-date total accumulated on meter 1.
Type of the secondary usage meter.
Most recent reading of the secondary meter.
Target service life threshold tied to meter 2.
Meter 2 reading at acquisition or baseline.
Date the baseline reading for meter 2 was recorded.
Life-to-date total accumulated on meter 2.
Type of the tertiary usage meter, if used.
Most recent reading of the tertiary meter.
Target service life threshold tied to meter 3.
Meter 3 reading at acquisition or baseline.
Date the baseline reading for meter 3 was recorded.
Life-to-date total accumulated on meter 3.
Transmission type or model (e.g., automatic, manual).
Transmission fluid capacity; confirm unit.
Manufacturer serial number for the transmission.
First name of the asset’s primary contact or responsible person.
Middle initial of the primary contact.
Last name of the asset’s primary contact or responsible person.
Email address for the asset’s primary contact.
Phone number for the asset’s primary contact.
Indicator of whether the contact receives preventive maintenance email alerts.
Meter used to schedule the 15-point inspection program (e.g., miles or hours); confirm logic.
Assumed annual inflation rate used in lifecycle cost or replacement planning (percentage).
Expected salvage value as a percentage of acquisition cost.
Amount accrued toward asset replacement funding; confirm currency and calculation.
Subject or title for the asset note.
Free-text note content associated with the asset.
